net.proteusframework.cms.controller

Class CKEditorConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • net.proteusframework.cms.controller.CKEditorConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Servlet, ServletConfig

    public class CKEditorConnector
extends HttpServlet
    Provides server side integration for the file browser in FCKeditor. Also some other misc. CMS integration.

    NOTE: this servlet must be mapped to ${ClassPathResourceFactory.path} + 'FCKeditor/connector'
    . If that ever needs to change, a configuration object will have to be created.

    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • registerConnectorInSession

        public static ConnectorRegistration registerConnectorInSession(String name,
                                               Class<? extends Connector> connectorClass)
        Register a Connector in the session. This will create a session if one doesn't already exist. This method can only be called while processing an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        name - a unique name.
        connectorClass - the connector class.
        Returns:
        the registration. If a registration already exists, it is returned instead.

      • registerConnectorInSession

        public static ConnectorRegistration registerConnectorInSession(String name,
                                               Connector connector)
        Register a Connector in the session. This will create a session if one doesn't already exist. This method can only be called while processing an HTTP request.

        Do not use this unless you absolutely have to - you don't, so don't use this. Use registerConnectorInSession(String, Class) instead.

        Parameters:
        name - a unique name.
        connector - the connector. You connector should not maintain any state.
        Returns:
        the registration. If a registration already exists, it is returned instead.
